page.title: 01Sgurr A'Mhadaidh Ruaidh
page.content: This block covers part of the spectacular escarpment, the backbone of the Trotternish Peninsula. Smoothly glaciated heather covered slopes to the west end abrupbly in basalt crags. Sgurr a'mhadaidh Ruaidh, one of the high points has featured in a children's book by a Skye writer, Allan Campbell Machean called The Hill of the Red Fox, a translation of the hill's name. Once, Loch Cuithir was the centre of a diatomite industry. Now there are only the ruined shells of huts & a dismantled railway line to show shrouded in mist, brooding and deserted except by trout fishers, hillwalkers, & occasionally a shepherd.
